head.title: Balducci's Opens a Bigger Shop Uptown, And Oh, What Crusts

hedline.hl1: Balducci's Opens a Bigger Shop Uptown, And Oh, What Crusts

abstract.p: Balducci's new branch to open on West 66th Street in Manhattan; photo (Food Stuff column) (S)

block.p: Balducci's new branch at 155A West 66th Street, which opens tomorrow, has a labyrinthine layout that recalls the Greenwich Village original, but the store is 50 percent larger. That means more shelf space in each department, especially meats, seafoods and cheeses (but alas, not roomier aisles).

Balducci's new branch at 155A West 66th Street, which opens tomorrow, has a labyrinthine layout that recalls the Greenwich Village original, but the store is 50 percent larger. That means more shelf space in each department, especially meats, seafoods and cheeses (but alas, not roomier aisles).

The store, now part of a Washington-based chain, Sutton Place Gourmet, offers the same prepared foods as the downtown store, with an expanded selection of ready-made sandwiches. Crisp-crusted sourdough breads, baked in the store throughout the day, include a dense and flavorful olive bread, an onion ciabatta, a semolina bread, a rosemary loaf, chewy country bread and an earthy, tangy rye and wheat Alsatian bread. They are 99 cents to $4.59.
